questions.text: Which of the following is not a MySQL index type?
Which of the following queries correctly retrieves all employee records whose birthday is today in MySQL?
options: SELECT * FROM employees WHERE birth_date = CURDATE();
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE MONTH(birth_date) = MONTH(CURDATE()) AND DAY(birth_date) = DAY(CURDATE());
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE DAYOFYEAR(birth_date) = DAYOFYEAR(CURDATE());
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE birth_date = NOW();
questions.correctAnswer: SELECT * FROM employees WHERE MONTH(birth_date) = MONTH(CURDATE()) AND DAY(birth_date) = DAY(CURDATE());

questions.text: Which of the following is a valid MySQL driver for PHP?
What is a key difference between MySQL and MySQLi extensions in PHP?
options: MySQLi supports multiple databases at once, while MySQL does not
MySQLi is object-oriented only, while MySQL is procedural only
MySQLi supports prepared statements, but MySQL does not
questions.correctAnswer: MySQLi supports prepared statements, but MySQL does not

questions.text: Which of the following is a feature supported by MySQLi but not by the old MySQL extension?
What is the primary difference between MyISAM and InnoDB storage engines in MySQL
options: MyISAM supports transactions, while InnoDB does not
InnoDB supports foreign keys, while MyISAM does not
MyISAM is faster for read/write operations compared to InnoDB
InnoDB stores data in flat files, while MyISAM uses binary format
questions.correctAnswer: InnoDB supports foreign keys, while MyISAM does not

questions.text: Which of the following is TRUE about the InnoDB storage engine?
options: It does not support row-level locking
It is the default engine for read-heavy applications
